intro: Coburgia stylosa, commonly known as the pink fairy tern, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. It has palmate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Coburgia stylosa is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
